pullRequest.title: Introduce built-in number operations in Qute extension

nodes.bodyText: Map is not a collection so we should probably extract the relevant methods in MapTemplateExtensions.
Maybe we should use a more generic name, ie. NumberTemplateExtensions?
Is it legal to use line breaks in source code callouts? I thought that you always need to use + here...
The brackets are optional and I'd say that map.keySet is more readable. The same applies to all snippets.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -171,6 +171,37 @@ public class ItemResource {
 <2> Make the `Item` object accessible in the template.
 <3> A static template extension method can be used to add "computed properties" to a data class. The class of the first parameter is used to match the base object and the method name is used to match the property name.
 
+== Built-in Template Extension methods
+
+Quarkus provides a set of built-in extension methods.
+
+=== Map extension methods:
+
+* `keys()` or `keySet()`: Returns a Set view of the keys contained in a map
+** `{#for key in map.keySet()}`

nodes.bodyText: I think that we should move this section to the reference guide instead: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/docs/src/main/asciidoc/qute-reference.adoc
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -171,6 +171,37 @@ public class ItemResource {
 <2> Make the `Item` object accessible in the template.
 <3> A static template extension method can be used to add "computed properties" to a data class. The class of the first parameter is used to match the base object and the method name is used to match the property name.
 
+== Built-in Template Extension methods

commit.message:
Introduce built-in number operations in Qute extension

Fixes #7283
